highlights: Debugged students code in C, C++, Java, and x86 Assembly.
Taught students about data structures, object-oriented programming, and program design.
Configured and deployed EC2 instances with Terraform.
Wrote to, read from, and monitored Kinesis streams used to process user data.
Refined a testing framework for the QA team in C#.
Performed deploys once a week with Jenkins to production environments.
Maintained Ruby scripts that automated the deployment and testing of code.
Designed and coded a web app from scratch with React, Java, and SQL.
Reduced the time taken to change weather alerts from an hour or more down to a few minutes.
Expanded Behave tests prior to implementation to promote test-driven development.
Contributed unit tests for a REST API written in Go.

projects.name: Context AR
highlights: Developed React components that allowed teachers to create and edit modules to guide students through a sequence of place-based lessons.
Drafted the database schema and translated it into two MongoDB collections with roles, permissions, and field requirements.
Coordinated the design of 16 views and tracked development progress with a wireframe.
Organized a Jira Kanban board, authored tickets for each view, and directed stand-ups.

projects.name: Functional Programming for Systems Software
highlights: Published an assessment of Habit, an experimental functional language for low-level programming.
Compared Habit with C by implementing a page table in both languages.
Used x86 Assembly to enable IA-32 paging and setup system calls.
